intro: Hypechusa lutea var. hirta, commonly known as the hairy yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its yellow, tubular flowers that bloom in summer, often found in rocky or dry habitats. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, which give it its varietal name "hirta." It is part of the Campanulaceae family, known for its bell-shaped flowers. This species is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
